title: Wall Street opens lower on fresh China worries
text:
Wall Street opens lower on fresh China worries

Stock Markets 40 minutes ago (Oct 16, 2019 09:47AM ET)

© Reuters. Traders work on the floor at the NYSE in New York (Reuters) - U.S. stocks opened lower Wednesday, as legislation targeting the Hong Kong protests stoked fears of more friction with China, even as another batch of positive earnings reports underscored a solid start to third-quarter results. The Dow Jones Industrial Average ( ) fell 52.49 points, or 0.19%, at the open to 26,972.31. The S&P 500 ( ) opened lower by 6.00 points, or 0.20%, at 2,989.68. The Nasdaq Composite ( ) dropped 28.90 points, or 0.35%, to 8,119.81 at the opening bell.

Wall Street opens lower on fresh China worries
description: Wall Street opens lower on fresh China worries
